N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3 ยง 419.2 - Escrow accounts

State Regulations
(a) A shortage, surplus or deficiency in a
borrower's escrow account shall be addressed by a servicer in accordance with
the provisions of RESPA, 12 C.F.R. section
1024.17(f). Alternatively, with the consent of the borrower, an escrow account surplus may be applied to
the principal balance. (b) If a
servicer advances funds in paying a disbursement, which is not the result of a
borrower's payment default under the underlying mortgage document, then the
servicer shall conduct an escrow account analysis to determine the extent of
the deficiency and shall provide a written explanation to the borrower. The
servicer shall wait 30 calendar days after providing the written explanation to
the borrower before seeking payment of the funds necessary to correct the
deficiency from the borrower. Notes
